FuncDef:
The display e1 controller cpos e1-number command displays the current statistics on alarms and error packets of E1 channels of a CPOS interface.
The display e1 controller cpos e1-number history command displays the current and historical statistics on alarms and error packets of an E1 channel of a CPOS interface.
CLIs: display e1 controller cpos <controller-number> e1-number <numberid> [ history ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the E1 channel number of a CPOS interface.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 63.

Specifies the controller number of a CPOS interface.
-

Examples: Father Physical layer is Packet Over SDH
Physical layer is Packet Over NO-CRC4
<HUAWEI> display e1 controller cpos 1/0/0 e1-number 1 history
Father physical layer is Packet Over SDH
Physical layer is Packet Over NO-CRC4
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To monitor interface status or locate interface faults, run the display controller cpos e1 history command to check the current and historical statistics on alarms and error packets.
Follow-up Procedure
If you want to collect statistics on alarms and error packets in a future specified period, run the reset e1 counters controller cpos command to clear the existing statistics on alarms and error packets.
